Description: Fragment of Samian pottery plate with low, slightly flaring ring foot, recessed circular area at centre of underside; matt black glaze with added red; inside surface carefully polished: frieze of alternating lotus flowers and buds around central medallion consisting of rosette framed by dotted metope pattern; exterior: part of motif on lower wall with reserved band below; lowest wall and outside of foot glazed; underside glazed save central recess, reserved with two circles preserved. Micaceous orange-brown clay with some large lime inclusions (Munsell 5YR 7/6). Drilled for analysis.
Curator's comments: Analysed by H. Mommsen with NAA (see Schlotzhauer & Villing 2006), sample Nauk 72, Group J.
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer & Villing 2006 / East Greek Pottery from Naukratis: The Current State of Research (p. 59, fig. 17)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.912)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 158-9, Nau 131, pl. 28j-k)
